body:
My results with the two backends for the benchmark script as it is in the repo:

```
==> Testing Float32 with skcuda backend, on GPU, forward
Elapsed time: 10.213950 [s / 10 evals], avg: 1.02 (s/batch)
michael@computer:~/code/scattering/pyscatwave/examples/2d$ SCATTERING_BACKEND_2D=torch python compute_speed.py 
==> Testing Float32 with torch backend, on CPU, forward
Elapsed time: 915.335427 [s / 10 evals], avg: 91.53 (s/batch)
==> Testing Float32 with torch backend, on GPU, forward
Elapsed time: 43.894291 [s / 10 evals], avg: 4.39 (s/batch)
michael@computer:~/code/scattering/pyscatwave/examples/2d$ 

```

@eugenium which backend were you using?

Using kymatio, but @eugenium s settings:

```
michael@computer:~/code/scattering/pyscatwave/examples/2d$ SCATTERING_BACKEND_2D=skcuda python eugene_speed.py 
==> Testing Float32 with skcuda backend, on GPU, forward
Elapsed time: 6.064638 [s / 10 evals], avg: 0.61 (s/batch)
michael@computer:~/code/scattering/pyscatwave/examples/2d$ SCATTERING_BACKEND_2D=torch python eugene_speed.py 
==> Testing Float32 with torch backend, on GPU, forward
Elapsed time: 30.909859 [s / 10 evals], avg: 3.09 (s/batch)

```

=> skcuda backend is still at a decent speed, no?
i'm a bit surprised by the 0.1s difference
Hmm I wouldn't jump to conclusions since these are two different computers (even though torch roughly corresponds) - @eugenium can you use skcuda Backend in kymatio ans Report Speed?

Thanks, I didnt try yet, but will tonight. It sounds like this is the issue. Indeed I did try to change the backend . but now realize I had done it the wrong way (didnt notice the docs). 

I think this is a major thing tho to make much more explicit to avoid losing lots of ppl due to it being slow. 

@eickenberg what are your thoughts of having skcuda as default i understand its not ideal

Alternatively,
Is it possible we could detect when the user is (a) on GPU and then throw a warning to tell them its much faster with this specific flag. I think many ppl will not read the docs and just assume its slow and abandon the whole ordeal.

rename.from: 2d has drastically slowed down on GPU versus pyscatwave
rename.to: Clear Instructions for Backend (was: 2d has drastically slowed down on GPU versus pyscatwave)

body: Again, I'm against not to have a native torch by default because not all the users have GPUs. However the documentation should be improved(at least the README)
@eugenium please take care of it and modify the doc such that new users are pointed to this issue quickly. Thanks

This is still a major issue. I attempted to use the software and could not  make the backend swith correctly.

I attempted to install from pip as in the README. I also attempted to install from source. In both cases I tried to set KYMATIO_BACKEND, as well as KYMATIO_BACKEND_2D... the torch backend is always picked up and no warnings are thrown:

KYMATIO_BACKEND_2D=skcuda python compute_speed.py
==> Testing Float32 with torch backend, on GPU, forward
Looks like this was due to a bug in the pip version that @eickenberg is now aware of !!

when did you install the pip version? The new one should actually work with
the correct env variables

On Tue, Nov 20, 2018 at 2:38 PM Eugene Belilovsky <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Looks like this was due to a bug in the pip version that @eickenberg
> <https://github.com/eickenberg> is now aware of !!
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/issues/125#issuecomment-440454452>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABPwC34qaAG60ZaY0jRm5X3FWnxtMPenks5uxIRNgaJpZM4YP7Bc>
> .
>

I propose to add a *Important for Deep Learning on Imagenet* section to the readme in order to make this very clear.

After release we can think about how to make this whole backend thing better

I find the collect_env.py script of PyTorch really useful for troubleshooting this kind of backend issues
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/pytorch/pytorch/master/torch/utils/collect_env.py

issue.title: ENH modifying website url+adding a note for imagenet

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration
